3:
Put your sword on your side, mighty one,
\q in your glory and your majesty.
\q
8:
All your garments smell of myrrh, aloes, and
cassia;
\q out of ivory palaces stringed instruments have made you glad.
\q
9:
Kings' daughters are among your honorable women;
\q at your right hand stands the queen clothed in gold of Ophir.
11:
In this way the king will desire your beauty;
\q he is your master; revere him.
13:
The royal daughter in the palace is all glorious;
\q her clothing is worked with gold.
14:
She will be led to the king in embroidered dress;
\q the virgins, her companions who follow her,
\q will be brought to you.
\q
15:
They will be led by gladness and rejoicing;
\q they will enter into the king's palace.
16:
In the place of your fathers will be your children,
\q whom you will make princes in all the earth.
\q
17:
I will make your name to be remembered in all generations;
\q therefore the peoples will give you thanks forever and ever.
45:
\m
\d For the chief musician; set to Shoshannim. A psalm of the sons of Korah. A maschil. A song of loves.
\q
